entry.title: Joule provisioning with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition using Cloud Integration Automation service
entry.content:
We are happy to announce that Joule integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition is now available in Cloud Integration Automation service as one of the integration scenarios.

Joule, being the next generation AI copilot from SAP, it is important for SAP to make Joule provisioning and setup easy and automated for its customers. Joule is available for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition within RISE with SAP. The existing manual integration process is complex, time consuming and the whole integration process can take weeks, but thanks to the automation capabilities provided by the Cloud Integration Automation service, the Joule integration set up is now much simpler and faster, reduced to just days.

By leveraging the Cloud Integration Automation service (offered as a service within BTP) at no additional cost, setting up Joule in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition is now considerably faster, simpler, and more reliable. This service allows for the automation of number of integration steps, significantly reducing the overall integration effort for SAP customers.

Customer can leverage ready-to-use guided workflows, automations, and role-specific execution to simplify and accelerate the entire Joule integration.

Involved Components

The different component involved are 

  • SAP BTP
  • SAP Cloud Connector
  • SAP S/4HANA PCE
  • SAP Cloud Identity Services

Though the Joule integration process is complex, the Cloud Integration Automation service is ideally positioned to connect Joule with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition for these reasons:

  • Cloud Integration Automation service being an AI enabled task orchestration tool.
  • Out of the box standardized guided workflows and role-based execution.
  • Integrated parameter management
  • Hybrid approach, where in it can automate the steps and provide a documentation which cannot be automated.
  • Cloud Integration Automation service comes with no additional cost and the service is available in SAP BTP.
  • Cloud Integration Automation service can provide the system landscape information hence bringing greater visibility of the entire customer landscape

The Joule integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition can be broadly classified into following:

1) SAP BTP Configuration

Tasks:

Task Name:

Automated / Manual

Creating new BTP sub account

Automated

Adding the entitlements to the subaccount for Joule, Cloud Identity Service and SAP Build Work Zone

Automated

Enabling Cloud Foundry

Automated

Establish trust with Cloud Identity Services

Automated

Activate SAP Work Zone, Connectivity service and create service keys

Automated

Activate Cloud Identity Service

Automated

Disable IDP and Trust domain.

Automated

2) SAP Cloud Connector configuration 

Tasks:

Task Name

Automated / Manual

Add subaccount in your SAP Cloud Connector

Automated

Create mapping virtual to internal systems (HTTP)

Automated

Create mapping virtual to internal systems (RFC)

Automated

Add resource path for HTTP & RFC

Automated

3) BTP Destinations

Tasks:

Task Name

Automated / Manual

Create Work Zone design time destination

Automated

Create Work Zone runtime destination

Automated

Retrieving nomination via the SAP Cloud Connector

Automated

Create Navigation Service

Automated

RFC destination for identity provisioning

Automated

Navigational and transactional capabilities

Automated

4) SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition configurations

Tasks:

Task Name

Automated / Manual

Activate SICF service

Automated

Exposing Roles (It works only for standard roles exposed by CDM)

Automated

Create catalog in Fiori launchpad designer

Manual

Create new role in role maintenance

Manual

5) Joule activation

Tasks:

Task Name

Automated / Manual

Run Booster from BTP cockpit

Manual

6) SAP work zone configuration

Tasks:

Task Name

Automated / Manual

Create content provider

Manual

7) SAP Cloud Identity services

Tasks:

Task Name

Automated / Manual

Trust the domain

Automated

Setup source system

Automated

Setup target system

Automated

Run/Schedule the job 

Manual

8 Launching Joule

Tasks:

Task Name:Automated/Manual
Refresh content in SAP Build Work ZoneManual
Launching JouleManual

Joule Provisioning Scenario using Cloud Integration Automation service

To kickstart Joule integration for your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, simply click on Joule Provisioning scenario in the Cloud Integration Automation service as highlighted in the below screen shot.

To conclude, Cloud Integration Automation service with its automation and workflow capabilities not only made the Joule integration easy and automated but also helps in accelerating the Joule adoption in the private cloud space.

If you want to know more about the Cloud Integration Automation service find related links and blogs below.

 What is Cloud Integration Automation Service? | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: Give your Joule Agents ğŸ¤– the gift of Memory ğŸ’­, with Hana Cloud âœ¨
entry.content:
When Joule agents can write/read memories in SAP HANA Cloud, they:

  • Remember business facts at scale (supplier habits, contract quirks, SLA exceptions) âœ…

  • Retrieve them fast & accurately with HANA Cloud Vector Engine âš¡

  • Keep memories human-readable, sortable, and dead-simple to implement ğŸ§©

That means fewer repeated mistakes, smarter suggestions, and agents that actually learn with your business over time.

An example of some memories for an invoice exception agent.
You can make them as detailed or a simple as you want in the agent prompt!

 

 

How it works

  1. A simple â€œMemoriesâ€ table

    Human-readable text + metadata (who/what itâ€™s about, when learned, importance, TTL, etc.).

    Optional: a vector column for semantic search.

  2. Vector search for recall

    Store an embedding of each memory â†’ use approximate nearest neighbor (ANN) to fetch the right facts instantly (â€œWhich supplier often uses expired POs?â€). BM25 or other strategies are available. I love BM25's reliability for same-language and same-topic knowledge meshes.

  3. One tool your agent calls

    Add a tool (below) so your agent can append or update memories whenever it learns something new.

  4. Update the Agent prompt to have it use the memory well!

           Something like:

Before answering, search (memory.search_hana) with a concise query (supplier/invoice/PO terms; limit top_kâ‰¤8); 
use the results to tailor your response. 
Only write when you learn a new, stable, factual business detail; 
upsert (memory.upsert_hana) instead of inserting duplicatesâ€”treat as duplicate if normalized context matches or vector similarity â‰¥0.86 and the same entity (supplier/invoice/PO) is involved; 
if duplicate, refresh last_seen_at (and occurrence_count if available). Format memories as one dense sentence in context 
(e.g., YYYY-MM-DD | INV-XXXX | Supplier ABC | PO 4500001123 | 4,980.00 EUR | expired PO used) 
and a brief actionable description; keep context â‰¤220 chars, use present tense. 
Set importance 1â€“5 (5 = critical risk) and ttl_days (low importance decays, 0 = never expires). 
Do not store ephemeral chatter or sensitive data; prefer patterns over one-offs. 
If you update or add a memory, mention it briefly to the user; otherwise be concise and never dump full tables unless asked.

 

Add two memory tools (Joule Skills)

"Add Memory" is a simple SQL Write

"Retrieve Memory" is a simple SQL Read, with semantic search (BM25+Embeddings)

 

 

Advanced memory patterns (that HANA makes easy) ğŸš€

  • Disappearing memories (decay/TTL): small quirks fade unless theyâ€™re re-observed.

  • Hierarchical memories: supplier-site â†’ supplier â†’ region â†’ global policy.

  • World representations: keep a simple graph of relationships (supplierâ†”plant, approverâ†”cost center), or materialize views for fast joins.

  • Learning from mistakes: tag memories with resolution outcome so the agent prefers strategies that worked.

 

Result:

A living, human-readable knowledge fabric your Joule agents can trust.
It's fast, explainable, and always improving. âœ¨

entry.title: Getting Ready for AI-Assisted Applicant Screening in SAP SuccessFactors
entry.content:
Getting Ready for AI-Assisted Applicant Screening in SAP SuccessFactors

Recruiting is one of the most time-consuming parts of HR. For many companies, every new job role attracts hundreds of CVs. Recruiters spend hours reading applications, hiring managers get frustrated waiting for shortlists, and candidates often feel lost in the process.

SAP SuccessFactors has introduced a new feature â€” AI-assisted applicant screening, powered by Joule â€” to make this easier. The idea is simple: the system can read applications, match skills to the job, and even rank candidates from best to least fit. This has the potential to change how recruiters work, but there is something important to understand.

This feature does not simply work out of the box. To get value from it, you first need to set up some important building blocks in your system.

What you need before enabling AI-assisted screening

Over the last few months of working with clients, I have seen that the success of AI-assisted screening depends on six key areas:

1. Recruiting Management (RCM)

This is the foundation. Without properly structured job requisitions, application templates, and candidate profiles, there is no data for AI to work on.

2. Job Profile Builder (JPB)

Job Profile Builder is where you define jobs, roles, competencies, and required skills. The better this is set up, the stronger the AI matching will be. Think of it as the dictionary that AI uses to understand your jobs.

3. Talent Intelligence Hub (TIH)

This is becoming more and more important. TIH provides a single skills framework across the system. When jobs and candidates speak the same â€œskills language,â€ the AI can make much better decisions about fit and ranking.

4. Joule with AI Units License

Joule is the intelligence layer inside SAP SuccessFactors. With the AI Units license, Joule can power features such as skills extraction, candidate-job matching, stack ranking, and even generating interview questions. Without Joule and the license, the feature cannot be enabled.

5. Role-Based Permissions (RBP)

Permissions are often overlooked. Recruiters and hiring managers need access to view AI insights, while system administrators need access to configure and monitor AI services.

6. Clean and consistent data

The simplest, but often the hardest step. If job descriptions are vague, or candidate data is incomplete, the AI will not give useful results. Clean data is the backbone of any successful AI implementation.

Why stack ranking makes a difference

The most useful feature of AI-assisted screening is stack ranking. This means applicants are automatically sorted from best fit to least fit based on the job requirements and the skills framework.

This helps in many ways:

  • Recruiters save time by not manually scanning hundreds of CVs.

  • Hiring managers get a clear shortlist and understand why certain candidates are ranked higher.

  • Every applicant is checked in the same way, which makes the process more consistent and fair.

  • Recruiters get more time to focus on meaningful conversations with candidates instead of repetitive screening tasks.

A real example from practice

One global technology company I worked with introduced AI-assisted screening for their campus hiring. They received thousands of applications for a single drive. Normally, this would take recruiters several weeks to manage.

With stack ranking enabled, the system automatically highlighted the most relevant candidates. The results:

  • Screening time reduced by 40 percent

  • Recruiters could finally spend more time engaging with students

  • Hiring managers felt the shortlist was of much higher quality

The company is now planning to extend this approach to experienced hiring as well.

Final thoughts

AI-assisted applicant screening in SAP SuccessFactors is not about replacing recruiters. It is about helping them focus on people, not paperwork.

But success depends on getting the basics right. Recruiting Management, Job Profile Builder, Talent Intelligence Hub, Joule with AI Units, Role-Based Permissions, and clean data â€” these are the real prerequisites.

Once these are in place, stack ranking can truly change the way hiring teams work â€” making recruitment faster, fairer, and more consistent.

entry.title: AI That Works for You: How SAP Fieldglass Is Redefining Workforce Management
entry.content:
SAP Fieldglass is redefining how companies manage their external workforce, thanks to the power of AI.

Smarter Talent Matching

AI-driven resume assessment and skills extraction help hiring managers to instantly identify top candidates. No more manual filtering, just intelligent recommendations that align with your job needs.

Generative AI for Job Descriptions & SOW creation

Need a Job Posting or Statement of Work? AI can draft, translate and tailor documents in seconds, saving time and ensuring consistency.

Joule: Your AI Assistant

Joule is SAP's assistant that leverages generative AI capabilities that lets you run reports, retrieve information and helps you complete tasks using conversational interactions.

Discover how AI can transform the way you hire, manage and optimise your external workforce with SAP Fieldglass.

To learn more about all things AI in SAP Fieldglass, check out:

  • AI and Machine Learning Capabilities at SAP Fieldglass
  • Joule in SAP Fieldglass

entry.title: Reinventing Customer Engagement : How SAP Joule Premium CX Shopping Agent Transforms Digital Sales
entry.content:
Introduction

AI agents are powerful tools designed to perform tasks autonomously, effectively mimicking human decision-making processes. Their integration into various business operations and everyday activities is rapidly increasing. So, what defines an AI agent?

AI agents are sophisticated software programs that leverage algorithms, data analysis, and machine learning techniques to carry out tasks that typically demand human intelligence. They are capable of reasoning, learning from experiences, and adapting to new challenges.

AI agents are categorized into several distinct types, including:

  • Chatbots
  • Virtual assistants
  • Recommendation systems
  • Autonomous vehicles And more

Each type has a specific purpose, and together, they significantly enhance efficiency and elevate user experiences.

AI agents have found applications across multiple sectors like Retail, wholesale, healthcare, finance, entertainment and home devices etc.  

SAP's Generative AI Initiatives focus on embedding generative AI across its enterprise solutions to enhance productivity, automation, customer experience and decision-making.

Hereâ€™s a concise overview:

Joule AI Copilot: A core component, Joule is a natural language generative AI assistant integrated into SAPâ€™s portfolio, including SAP S/4HANA, SAP SuccessFactors, SAP Customer Experience (CX), and more.

SAP CX AI Toolkit: Tailored for Customer Experience solutions (e.g., SAP Commerce Cloud, SAP Sales Cloud), this toolkit leverages generative AI for smart product recommendations, dynamic pricing, personalized search, and automated content creation (e.g., product descriptions, marketing emails). It integrates enterprise data with AI models to drive personalization and efficiency.

SAP Business AI: This broader initiative embeds generative AI across SAPâ€™s cloud solutions, including ERP, supply chain, and HR. Key features include:

AI initiative on SAP Customer Experience

The SAP Customer Experience (CX) AI Initiative focuses on integrating advanced artificial intelligence, particularly generative AI, into SAPâ€™s Customer Experience solutions to enhance sales, e-commerce, customer service, and marketing.

SAP CX AI Toolkit: A suite of AI-powered tools that integrates with SAP CX applications (e.g., SAP Commerce Cloud, SAP Sales Cloud) to automate tasks, provide real-time insights, and deliver personalized customer experiences. It leverages enterprise data, proprietary AI models, and large language models (LLMs) for features like smart product recommendations, Customer reviews Sentimental analysis, Visual search and personalized shopping agent  , and automated  product content creation.

Pleaser refer the blog for CX AI toolkit features CX AI in E-Commerce: Transforming Customer Journey... - SAP Community .In this blog, we will explore the shopping agent

The SAP Commerce Cloud CX AI Toolkit Shopping Agent is an artificial intelligence-driven conversational tool aimed at improving the e-commerce experience on the SAP Commerce Cloud platform.

This conversational AI assistant operates as a well-informed digital sales representative, accessible around the clock on your storefront.

By utilizing generative AI and natural language processing, it offers personalized and seamless customer interactions, facilitating product discovery and increasing conversion rates. The shopping agent assists customers in locating the appropriate products through engaging conversations that include relevant pricing information. Additionally, it answers inquiries regarding products, enables product comparisons, allows items to be added to the cart, and provides updates on placed order.

Commerce Product Discovery challenge which are addressed by Shopping Agent 

10% of customers find exactly what theyâ€™re searching for every time

80% of customers leave websites because search didnâ€™t meet expectations

 

 

Traditional commerce gives customer a categories-based search, large number of products to filter manually and fail to provide the granular details of product which they are looking for, making them guess and buy or leave the journey

Using shopping agents, eCommerce customers can meet their key buying journey demands

  • A guiding agent to support their broader mission likeâ€ I need to purchase for this projectâ€
  • The support to help them to reach the product with specific requirements quickly
  • Assisting them in building and completing the shopping mission by suggesting the product set of solution comprise of set of products 
  • Overall, a digital sales associate which helps
    • To have Natural conversation about needs
    • Understands broad scenarios/ Specific requirements
    • Ask questions and get relevant answers about product 
    • Recommends complementary products
    • Compares features & pricing
    • Helping them to finish the purchase and track the same
       

      B2B and B2C Scenarios are handled by Shopping Agent 

B2C Sample Scenarios:

  • A customer asks, â€œCan you recommend a waterproof jacket for under $100?â€ The Shopping Agent responds with tailored recommendations by pulling real-time data from the product catalog and other sources available on Azure Cloud.
  • Customers can also start with broader queries, such as, "Can you suggest some outfits for a summer vacation?" They can ask the Shopping Agent to recommend appropriate sizes, for example, "What size of formal wear would be suitable for someone who is 174 cm tall and weighs 65 kg?"
  • Additionally, customers may inquire about accessories that complement their main outfit, asking, "Can you suggest formal shoes or a handbag that would go well with this dress?"
  • Customers can also ask about the material of a dress, maintenance tips, and suggestions for appropriate occasions to wear specific outfits.

B2B Sample Scenarios:

  • B2B customer inquiry about bulk pricing and compatibility for a specific Model of engineering tool. The agent provides instant answers and suggests related items, streamlining the purchase process
  • B2B customer can ask about the product comparison, volume price options  -Can you compare the motors Sharp PowerE 22i  and  Sharp PowerE 11i?
  • B2B customer can ask about the warranty, annual maintenance terms and contract cost for the engineering tool â€“ â€œSuggest me the annual maintenance contract options for the Troponin Analyzerâ€ or â€œcan you guide me on the installation procedure for Siemens Chemistry AnalyzerA500 ?
  • B2B customers may the compatible accessories for the product â€“ â€œCan you suggest the accessories to setup the Rotary Hammer?â€
  • B2B customers may also ask to order product to cart and check the status of the latest order â€“â€œ Can you add the Switch gear EV550C to cart?â€  or â€œCan you tell me status of my last order?â€
  • B2B customers may ask non product information to the agent - â€œDirect me to FAQ document  or  guide me on payment /refund termsâ€  

Core Capabilities of the SAP CX AI Toolkit Shopping Agent

Shopping agent caters the following three boarder areas.

Specific Requests: I need products with these specific features

Broader Scenarios: I need equipment for this project

Complete Solutions: Help me build a complete solution

 

Digital Service Agent offers the following, 

  • User-friendly configuration interface for creating and customizing self-service agent
  • Ability to easily download and access chat history via the Agent Builder UI
  • Handoff to Support Channel for complex issues or user-requested human assistance, ensuring a smooth transition for effective problem resolution
  • Create a support ticket, complete with a detailed conversation summary, when the agent is unable to resolve the issue
  • AI-powered self-service using product documentation and FAQâ€™s through natural conversation
  • Plug into the digital outlet of your choice such as a Business Portal or e-commerce storefront through a flexible API

Benefits of using shopping agent

Modular: Shopping Agent is modular, powered by combing the one or many of sub-agents which serves unique purpose, (PriceRecommendationAgent, Add to Cart Agent, Order Status Agent, Self Service Agent). Admin can activate/deactivate the sub-agents during configuration based on the business needs 

Flexibility on utilizing information to guide the customer:  Shopping Agent utilizes the information from the following sources to guide the customer 

  • Commerce product content management (tag, description, attributes, price, media and description) 
  • Product documentation such as installation guides, warranty and Maintenace guides attached as document in PCM or any external sources like Azure Media
  • Any internal (commerce cloud) or external location which serves non product information 
  • Order status and shipping information on order history 
  • Service ticket information from Service Cloud or Commerce Cloud

 Natural Language Interaction:  The Shopping Agent enables customers to engage in natural, conversational queries about products, such as details on features, pricing, availability, or compatibility. It understands complex, multi-part requests, mimicking the expertise of an in-store assistant.

Seamless Integration with SAP Commerce Cloud and external resources like Azure

The Shopping Agent is fully embedded within the SAP ecosystem, allowing it to leverage enterprise data from SAP Commerce Cloud, also connect with external systems like Microsoft Azure Blob Storage for enhanced functionality

Multilingual Support

   The agent supports multiple languages and enables facilitates global customer engagement by generating content in the customerâ€™s preferred language or matching the input language

 Enhanced Product Discovery by incorporating ask the product

 Features like â€œAsk About a Productâ€ allow customers to pose specific questions (e.g., about materials or care instructions) and receive instant responses, improving the shopping experience.

Enterprise-Grade Security

   - The agent ensures data privacy by preventing the storage of customer data in third-party large language models (LLMs) or SAP models. It uses secure data retrieval from SAP CX sources, with features like context grounding and PII (Personally Identifiable Information) obfuscation.

Shopping Agent â€“ Reference Architecture

Shopping Agent Implementation Steps:

 

Shopping Agent â€“ Roadmap

Here the list of roadmap capabilities

  • Ask questions about product availability and the ability to exclude out of stock products from recommendations.
  • Order status includes tracking numbers
  • Automatically recognize product-specific questions on product detail pages. Product pages display clickable, AI-generated questions to start agent conversations
  • Power product recommendations and complementary suggestions using external catalog data
  • Support for Q&A from PDF documents stored as media or classification attributes.

Resources to refer

  • Learning: Utilizing SAP CX AI Toolkit for SAP Commerce Cloud 
  • Doc 
    •  SAP CX AI Toolkit Features | SAP Help Portal 
    • User Guide | SAP Help Portal
  • Webcast: https://gateway.on24.com/wcc/eh/2983783/lp/4635850/master-your-product-catalog-with-business-ai-for-...
  • YouTube: SAP CX AI Toolkit - YouTube 
  • CX AI Toolkit blog: Integrating SAP CX AI Toolkit with SAP Commerce Cl... - SAP Community
  • Source code:   source code is ready to use (composable storefront only) - Open-source code* HERE
  • AI hub: Rest API for shopping Agent and Digital Service Agent can be used from API business hub https://api.sap.com/package/SAPCXAIToolkit/rest

 

 Conclusion

Shopping Agent empowers customers by supporting diverse shopping scenarios, from specific product searches to broader project needs, improving conversion rates, enhancing customer satisfaction, and facilitating a more efficient shopping experience.  Hope the information is useful, if  you like to explore, please reach out to your SAP representative. 

Thank you for your time!

entry.title: Unlocking the Potential of SAP AI in Procurement
entry.content:
Hello, Martin Beganyi here again, Program Lead at Procurement Adoption Office.  

You may know me from my previous contributions as part of the Solution Value Advisory team for EMEA/MEE.

Recently, I have transitioned to the newly established Procurement Adoption Office, where I now lead two global adoption programs: one focused on driving the adoption of SAP Aribaâ€™s Category Management solution, and the second dedicated to accelerating the uptake of AI-powered features across SAP Procurement solutions, specifically SAP Fieldglass and SAP Ariba - This blog is dedicated to the latter, the transformative role of SAP AI in Procurement. 

Through years, Iâ€™ve observed a consistent challenge: many organizations are unaware of the full suite of AI capabilities embedded in their SAP procurement solutions.  Despite the growing availability of these advanced features, adoption remain low or inconsistent, limiting the value customers can unlock. 

To address this, we have launched a global program to help customers to adopt AI features in core solutions for example, Strategic Sourcing, Fieldglass, and Buying. 

Introducing the AI Toolkit 

The cornerstone of our initiative is the AI Toolkit â€” a concise, easy-to-understand resource that compiles essential information about all available AI functionalities.  Designed for those new to AI, the toolkit cuts through the noise of overwhelming information, providing a clear starting point for customers and partners alike.  We encourage you to download, share, and leverage this toolkit within your teams:   

  • AI in Procurement Toolkit (Aug2025).pdf 

Engage with Our Interactive Learning Opportunities 

To further support adoption, we host a series of live webinars where we delve into the value of individual AI features, demonstrate activation steps, and showcase practical usage scenarios. Here are some of the upcoming sessions: 

  • Registration for On24 Sessions 

For our Preferred Success customers, we can offer a dedicated one-on-one expert led engagements, including hands-on activation of AI features aligned with your business needs. 

Join Our Open Office Hours 

Additionally, we run a recurring series of â€˜Openâ€™ hour to all SAP customers which offers a flexible way to ask questions, seek real-time answers, and gain clarity on AI capabilities. 

Upcoming â€˜Openâ€™ hours (EMEA/APAC): 

  • Sept 9th - Open Hour (EMEA/APAC)â€‹ 
  • Sept 23rd - Open Hour (EMEA/APAC)â€‹ 
  • Oct 7th â€“ Open Hour (EMEA/APAC)â€‹ 
  • Oct 21st â€“ Open Hour (EMEA/APAC)â€‹ 
  • Nov 4th â€“ Open Hour (EMEA/APAC)â€‹ 
  • Nov 18h â€“ Open Hour (EMEA/APAC)â€‹ 
  • Dec 2nd â€“ Open Hour (EMEA/APAC)â€‹ 
  • Dec 16th â€“ Open Hour (EMEA/APAC) 

Next Steps 

We invite you to explore our AI Toolkit, participate in the webinars, or attend the SAP â€˜Openâ€™ hours.  To schedule a dedicated session tailored to your organizationâ€™s needs, please reach out to your Customer Success Manager who can support you. 

Thank you for your time and interest in advancing procurement with AI.  Together, we can unlock new efficiencies and drive strategic value across your supply chain. 

Best regards, 

Martin Beganyi

entry.title: SAP Developer News September 4th, 2025
entry.content:
DESCRIPTION

PODCAST: https://podcast.opensap.info/sap-developers/2025/09/04/sap-developer-news-september-4th-2025/â†—

SAP Build introduces new MCP Servers

  • SAP Build introduces new MCP Servers to enable agentic development for Enterprise Applications: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-build-introduces-new-mcp-servers-to-enable-agentic-development-for/ba-p/14205602
  • Introducing the MCP Server for CAP: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/boost-your-cap-development-with-ai-introducing-the-mcp-server-for-cap/ba-p/14202849
  • First Release of the SAP Fiori MCP Server for Agentic AI Workflows: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-fiori-tools-update-first-release-of-the-sap-fiori-mcp-server-for/ba-p/14204694
  • Introducing the UI5 MCP Server: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/give-your-ai-agent-some-tools-introducing-the-ui5-mcp-server/ba-p/14200825
  • AI agents talk at SIT Porto: https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7358844307413393408/

ABAP Partner Reference Application

  • ABAP Partner Reference Application: https://github.com/SAP-samples/abap-partner-reference-application?tab=readme-ov-file

Step-by-step guidance to extend Joule via Joule Studio in SAP Build (Live Session)

  • Step-by-step guidance to extend Joule via Joule Studio in SAP Build (Live Session): https://learning.sap.com/live-sessions/step-by-step-guidance-to-extend-joule-via-joule-studio-in-sap-build

 

CHAPTER TITLES

0:00 Intro

0:10 SAP Build introduces new MCP Servers

2:28 Step-by-step guidance to extend Joule via Joule Studio in SAP Build (Live Session)

3:06 ABAP Partner Reference Application

 

TRANSCRIPTION

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for September 4th, 2025.

[Witalij] If you see me wearing this T-shirt, you can be sure it's about AI. And you are absolutely right. This announcement has been wildly shared this week, but in case you missed it, we at SAP have introduced MCP servers to bring the Model Context Protocol into enterprise application development. The emerging open standard Mobile Context Protocol defines how large-language models can access tools and project context in a secure and structured way. Three servers are now available. For the Cloud Application Programming Model, for SAP Fiori Elements, and for SAPUI5. Let's double-click on each of them. The CAPMCP server has been released as open source under the Apache 2.0 license. It provides two tools for AI-assisted development of CAP applications, one to search across the compiled CDS model and one to search the CAP documentation. The Fiori MCP server lets AI agents generate and edit Fiori applications, discover apps in the workspace, and follow built-in rules that enforce best practices. This speeds up prototyping and makes iterations easier. The server is actually available as an experimental release. The UI5 MCP server equips your AI agents with six tools. This range from best practice guidelines and product scaffolding to searching the API reference, linking code and fixing deprecated APIs, providing insights into the project details. By releasing the CUP server as open source and extending MCP to Fiori and UI5, we are building an ecosystem where AI agents can actively support enterprise development. To learn more, we invite you to explore the CAP MCP server on GitHub, try out the UI5 and Fiori Elements servers in your own projects, and share your feedback on SAP community. And be sure to follow upcoming updates in SAP Build Code to see how Joule continues to expand MCP-based scenarios. By the way, if you are interested in AI agents, this month I will be presenting this very topic at SAP Meetup in Luz, in Poland, and at SAP Insight Track in Porto, Portugal. See you then.

[Nora] I have some great news for our listeners with a Learning Hub subscription, because the AI advocacy team is hosting a live session called Step-by-Step Guidance to Extend Joule by Joule Studio in SAP Build. It's going to take place on the 16th of September at 11 Central European Summertime, 11 a.m. It's targeted at developers. It's going to be a hands-on session that will teach you everything you need to know about Joule Studio, how to build your custom skills, how to integrate it into other systems, and how to test and deploy your skill. And it's targeted at beginners. So make sure you sign up and learn from the experts themselves.

[M K, Sheena] By leveraging the SAP BTP ABAP environment and the ABAP RESTful Application Programming model, you can build applications side-by-side to SAP solutions such as SAP S/4HANA Cloud. This GitHub repository provides a sample partner reference application called Music Festival Manager to build, deploy, and run side-by-side multi-tenant applications based on the SAP EVTP APAC Cloud to extend and integrate with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. These applications ensure SAP standards for enterprise-grade business solutions and also offers a consistent, harmonized user experience. The advantages include a clean code for a page safety, a scalable cloud development model, and secure integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud. In addition to the step-by-step tutorial, it also includes sizing guides, build materials, best practices, and tools for building multi-tenant extensions. Check out the GitHub repository link in the description box below and start building your enterprise create SaaS applications today.

entry.title: Transformative Lessons from SAP NOW AI Tour Argentina
entry.content:
On August 28th, SAP brought its renowned SAP NOW AI Tour to Argentina, offering a unique opportunity for local professionals to engage with cutting-edge AI innovations. We had the honor of participating in sessions where more than 1,000 experts shared their innovative ideas, experiences, and case studies. The event featured an extensive catalogue of talks, covering a wide range of topics related to various fields of interest regarding AI, ensuring there was something valuable for everyone. In the following sections, I will share my personal insights and reflections on the talks I attended and the overall event.

Reflecting on the occasion, the word that comes to mind is "transformative" due to the profound impact of the event. On one hand, it was a huge source of inspiration: new ideas, visions, interesting strategies, and personal experiences were shared. On the other hand, it provided practical insights through real cases and projects. This means that all the experts were capable of delivering not only an aspirational message, but also some proof that served as a truthful outcome.

One of the strongest ideas presented during the event was the notion of a virtuous circle created by the integration of applications, data, and artificial intelligence. We were shown how these elements, when working together, can generate outcomes that are more resilient, more sustainable, and more efficient. What struck me the most is that this perspective positioned AI not as something external or distant, but as an element that can and should be embedded into our everyday processes. For a company like ours, this confirmed that the future of AI lies in making it part of the very foundation of the business.

Another highlight was seeing Joule, and the different ways in which it is already being applied. We learned that it has the potential to simplify a great portion of repetitive tasks, allowing teams to dedicate their time and creativity to areas that truly generate value. 

Finally, the reflections on responsible AI gave the sessions a deeper meaning. Beyond the technical demonstrations, there was a constant reminder of the importance of building systems that are transparent and trustworthy. For me, this emphasis on ethics was essential: it reminded us that innovation must go hand in hand with accountability, especially when the goal is to design solutions that people will rely on every day. 

Despite the diversity of experts and talks, a common theme emerged: there is no single correct way to achieve success. The real challenge is to find the method, the technique, the strategy that best works for you. About the topic, experts at the event encouraged us to take advantage of all the tools and resources available to build an efficient ecosystem that adapts to our needs and showcases our uniqueness.

Connected with what was said above, this phrase resonated with me the most: you have to pluck up the courage and just do things. Success is the best teacher for failure. In order to succeed in something, it is necessary to conceive the idea of failing as something inevitable â€“ and indispensable â€“ and to include it within the planning towards a goal. Otherwise, the frustration will be not only unbearable, but we will forget about how important it is for our progress. Where would we take the valuable lessons from, if not from failing time after time? Consider this: if you are not experiencing failures, it might indicate that you are not challenging yourself or progressing. A lack of failure could mean that you are stuck in the same place.

And what about you? Have you attended the SAP AI Tour yet? When is it coming to your city? Have you learned anything that has impacted the way you view AI? What are your expectations if you are planning to attend this event in the future?

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA Cloud for group reporting - Release 2508 is generally available
entry.content:
Weâ€™re continuing our strategic investment in group reporting to simplify financial closing, enhance user experience, and accelerate your consolidation process. Today, weâ€™re pleased to announce the release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud for group reporting version 2508 launched on August 18, 2025. This latest release introduces powerful new features and integrates business AI capabilities into your software.

Key new and enhanced features in 2508 include:

  • Integration of Joule, our AI copilot, in group reporting
  • AI-assisted insights for group financial statement review booklet
  • Integration with SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC)
  • New consolidation auto post rules engine app
  • One-click consolidation in a new consolidation monitor app
  • Customer-defined sign convention
  • Accountant-friendly display of manual journal entries in debit-credit
  • Integration of balance validations and notifications in GRDC package
  • Export questions and answers from GRDC forms
  • Ability to enter or load reported data for dimension totals
  • Cross-version validations and dynamic version comparison in analytics
  • And many more improvements on data collection, data quality, analytics and master data

Download our feature deck.

-
Integration of Joule, our AI copilot, in Group Reporting

Joule is SAPâ€™s AI copilot - leveraging its generative AI capabilities, Joule aims to understand your requests, retrieve information, and complete your tasks in a conversational way. For example, instead of manually navigating to a feature or page buried deep, you can describe the current task to Joule, who can help automate tasks or take you to places where you can find desired data. By using Joule, you can easily interact with the system and increase your productivity.

Group Reporting now integrates with two Joule capabilities.

Since June 2025, Group Reporting integrates with Joule's informational capability. This conversational search capability helps you retrieve necessary information from the SAP Help Portal or documents uploaded to the Joule service if you've set up Document Grounding. Joule searches available Group Reporting documentation and it's own knowledge base to find the answer to your query and summarizes the search results and provides the summarization as the answer to your question, along with the top three search results.

Released in version 2508, Jouleâ€™s navigational capability is now integrated in Group Reporting. This capability helps you find and navigate to the Group Reporting functionality or apps you're looking for without having to go through multiple links to reach a destination. â€‹With Joule, you can easily navigate across Group Reporting with navigational interactions. â€‹Joule offers a navigational link that opens the relevant app and interface in a new browser tab. At the destination, you can continue from where you left off, with your previous conversation history.

Below is an example of navigation with Joule in Group Reporting. You're finished working on exchange rates (1), and tell Joule you'd "like to see group journal entry" (2) . Our AI copilot proposes three possible apps either to post or display journal entries. As you want to create a new journal entry, you just select the Post Group Journal Entries app and (3) Joule opens it.

More information: Joule informational capability, Document grounding, Joule navigational capability

-
AI-assisted insights for group financial statement review booklet

With version 2508, you can now use AI-generated analyses and summaries of your data in the Group Financial Statements Review Booklet app. You can use AI-assisted business insights for the Profit & Loss (nature of expense) and access it in the side panel. Based on the data displayed, you can do the following AI-assisted analyses: bottom-line growth, EBIT, EBITDA, financial result, operating income/loss, profitability, top-line growth and currency variance.

Business insights combine drilldown and filter actions with AI prompts, accessing large language model in SAP Business Technology Platform. They automate navigation and provide you with explanations of the data. Business insights answer predefined business questions and provides you with summarized information on your financial statements. In addition, you'll soon be able to leverage AI-assisted insights to summarize the comments in your financial statements (this innovation is planned for version 2508.1).

More information: AI-Assisted Business Insights in 'Group Financial Statements Review Booklet' App

-
Integration with SAP Business Data Cloud

SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) leverages our extensive portfolio of business applications and our customersâ€™ diverse data architectures to create a unified, semantically rich data environment built on a single semantic model. This environment serves as the data foundation for our AI-First strategy and is planned to become the preferred gateway for customers to extract data from SAP and non-SAP systems.

As depicted in the diagram below, in addition to the integration with BDC Analytics Cloud, in 2025 we strengthened Group Reporting integration with BDC by delivering content for Datasphere and integrating Group Reporting Data Collection (GRDC) with Datasphere.

 

Delivered in Q1-2025, the Group Reporting content in Datasphere allows to perform reporting on consolidated data within BDC. The content package includes the following (see screenshot below):

  • Extraction of Group Reporting master data
  • Extraction of Group Reporting raw transactional data
  • Group Reporting logic built in SAP Datasphere

The data model is implemented based on the data structures used in Group Reporting and leverages standard CDS views to extract and load data. It covers among others version relations including extension versions, group derivation logic based on group structure as well as hierarchy elimination. With the help of this content package, you can integrate your Group Reporting data with other data sets within Datasphere. Please note the reporting items and reporting rules are not yet be part of the content. We plan to remove this restriction together with this related innovation on reporting rules.

In September 2025 with version 2508.2, we'll deliver BDC integration in Group Reporting Data Collection (GRDC). With this new feature, you can use Datasphere as a source in your data mapping definition. You have the ability to load data from Datasphere into Group Reporting with GRDC mapping. You can define new sources for Datasphere models, and use defined sources in GRDC. 

More information: Group Reporting content in Datasphere, Datasphere integration in GRDC

-
New consolidation auto post rules engine

You now benefit from a new rule engine to automate your consolidation postings. This engine is inspired by SAP Financial Consolidation and aims to offer the same level of power and flexibility valued by its users. 

We increased flexibility of the rule definition compared to existing consolidation rules:

  • Flexible definition of source data
  • Assignment of multiple document types in one task
  • Multiple posting lines
  • Flexible definition of the target data (field assignment, value calculation)
  • Inclusion of the results of previous rule steps as an option
  • Enhanced partner filter for intra-unit eliminations
  • Field Assignment option Value Of to post on partner fields
  • Inclusion of Rules to Nodes and Rule Groups
  • Flexible assignment of Rule Groups to the Tasks
  • Modern Task Log

Since June 2025, you can leverage our new rule engine to automate postings for consolidation units for local close (posting levels 00, 0C, 01, 10). Check out here for more information.

With version 2508, you can now also use our new rule engine to automate inter-unit eliminations for pairwise elimination (posting level 20). This feature enables you to automatically post group journal entries for pairs of consolidation units by running consolidation tasks in the consolidation monitor. It allows you to eliminate intercompany transactions, such as sales, other income/expenses, and accounts receivable/accounts payable, for example. 

As we move forward in 2025, we plan to release incremental innovations to automate consolidation groupâ€“related postings in the consolidation monitor on posting level 30, and replace reclassifications on posting level 30 (see our roadmap). 

More information:

  • Manage Rules for Automatic Postings
  • Assign Rule Groups for Automatic Postings
  • Display Logs for Automatic Postings
  • Import/Export Current Settings
  • Automatic Postings for Pairs of Consolidation Units
  • Automate consolidation groupâ€“related postings | SAP Roadmap 

-
One-click consolidation in a new consolidation monitor app

Available since June 2025, we deliver a new version of the Consolidation Monitor. You can now work in a modern user interface powered by the latest Fiori technology, including features like filtering and sorting.

To enhance your closing process experience, you're able to perform several actions with just one click â€“ for example, you can carry out a full consolidation or open and close periods effortlessly (see the screenshot below). You can improve usability by switching from the existing app to this new version with its updated interface. You're able to increase efficiency by performing actions across multiple values, including tasks, groups, and periods. Additionally, you can streamline operations by opening or closing multiple periods, running full consolidations, and automating task processing through task scheduling.

More information: One-click consolidation in a new consolidation monitor app

-
Customer-defined sign convention

From 2508.1 release, planned in September 2025, you'll be able to define your own sign logic, instead of the SAP sign logic. The SAP sign logic interprets positive amounts for each financial statement item as debit amounts and negative amounts as credit amounts. For instance, revenue is stored as a negative amount. With 2508.1, you can specify if the financial statement items should be posted as debit amounts or credit amounts.

â€‹You can select the default sign behavior of your financial statement items:

  • Debit item: a positive number is a debit
  • Credit item: a positive number is a credit

For example, you can opt for the following sign convention:

  • Assets are debit financial statement items: gross values are entered as positive amounts; amortization, depreciation and impairment are entered as negative amounts
  • Equity & liabilities are credit: amounts are entered as positive amounts
  • Income statement are credit: revenues are entered as positive amounts, expenses as negative amounts

In this example, the movements (subitems) behave as follows:

  • Assets /Gross values and Equity & Liabilities: increases are entered as positive amounts, decreases
    as negative amounts
  • Assets /Amort. Depr. & Impairment: increases are entered as negative amounts, decreases as positive
    amount

More information: Configurable sign convention for data inputs and data processing  

-
Accountant-friendly display of manual journal entries in debit-credit

Available since June 2025, we enhanced the usability of the "Post Group Journal Entries" app. You can choose to enter manual group journals with a Debit/Credit indicator and sign-free amounts. When you activate this new layout, the manual journal entry is more accountant-oriented. This new feature changes only the display of the journals; it doesnâ€™t change the way they're stored in the database. It's also applied to previously posted journals.

More information: Debit/Credit Indicator in the Manual Group Journal Entries Apps 

-
Integration of balance validations and notifications in GRDC package

We continue to deliver on the integration of the Data Monitor capabilities in Group Reporting Data Collection (GRDC) package. In addition to the integration of the release, data collection, annual net income and line validation tasks, in 2508 you can now benefit from the balance validation task integration in your package. With this integration, you're able to control the consistency of your consolidation unit reported data directly in the package.

Typical balance validations in GRDC include:

  • Assets equal Equity and Liabilities
  • Gross value of assets higher or equal to depreciation and impairment
  • Exhaustive breakdown of investment in subsidiaries by shares
  • Complete analysis of investment in subsidiaries, net equity or assets and liabilities by movements

You can use balance validations effectively in a staggered consolidation approach, where you use GRDC to collect data step by step in a phased manner. You define multiple data entry steps within a package. Each step targets a specific type of data and validations (like P&L, Balance Sheet, Intercompany, or Disclosures) and you're able to schedule them in a specific order. This lets you validate and complete each phase before moving to the next, ensuring data quality and control throughout the close process.

In addition, you can now receive notifications for the tasks you run for a package in the GRDC Enter Package Data app. These notifications keep you informed about the status and progress of your tasks, for example, reported data validation task. The task can be underway or completed successfully, with warning or with errors (see screenshot below).

More information: GRDC - Integrate balance validation task into the package, and receive notifications 

-
Export questions and answers from GRDC forms

In 2508.2, you'll be able to export all Q&A and text entered in GRDC Forms via the new Export Questions and Answers app.

When you add questions to your Forms, you collect additional textual information that becomes part of the financial data submitted to the Group. With the new Export Q&A to CSV function, you can easily extract all responses and use them for deeper insights, reporting, or decision-making. This makes it easier for you to work with qualitative data alongside your financial results.

Exporting Q&A is simple. Just follow these steps:

  1. Open the Export Package Data app.
  2. Use the filters at the top to select the Package you want to export.
  3. Click the Create QA Export button. Youâ€™ll see the progress in the task list.
  4. Once the task is finished, a Download button will appear.
  5. Click the Download button to save the CSV file directly to your desktop.

More information: Export Q&A from GRDC

-
Ability to enter or load reported data for dimension totals

With version 2508, when you upload data (using the GRDC Data Mapping or Import Reported Data apps) or when you input data manually (in the GRDC Enter Package Data app) you can now choose to activate the Total Mode option to load reported data with some missing dimension values. The total value of such a dimension is then aggregated without changing the existing values of the same dimension.

For example, this new feature helps you to load a provisional balance sheet without breaking it down into subitems that can contain the details of a functional transaction type. The balance carry forward has already filled the opening subitem and this value will not change when the balance sheet is loaded. Instead, the delta is calculated and saved in a standard transaction type.

Here's an example of how you can load data using the new Total Mode option - here, in GRDC Data Mapping.

(1) On the opening balance, consolidation unit "CU001 - France" has a detail of 500 â‚¬ on partner "CU002 - Germany" for the financial item 121190 - Trade receivables.

(2) Intercompany on Trade receivables is now 700 â‚¬, and is imported with GRDC Data Mapping.

(3) With the Total Mode option, 200 â‚¬ is automatically stored on the variation movement.

The uploaded amount of 700 is handled as a total. A delta amount of 200 between the uploaded amount of 700 on subitem 915 and the already present amount of 500 on subitem 900 is written to subitem 915 for FS item 121190 and partner CU002.

More information: Create Totals for Reported Data with Missing Dimension Values

-
Other innovations

Master data

  • Customer changes of SAP pre-defined selection objects are now supported
  • Parent method change in the Manage Group Structure app for activity-based consolidation of investments

Data collection

  • Multi-tab management in GRDC package
  • Decimal places for quantities based on unit of measure in GRDC package
  • New sign convention in data source import option of GRDC data mapping to adhere to customer sign convention
  • Enhanced documentation for changed treatment of product group in the release universal journal

Data quality and governance

  • New user roles to refine modification and access rights on GRDC data mapping definitions and jobs
  • Ability to generate/save a traceability log for each unique data mapping context in GRDC data mapping
  • New option to overwrite rule control level in line-item validations 
  • Automation of data collection control via control fields substitution in the activity-based consolidation of investments 

Analytics

  • Cross-version validations and dynamic version comparison in analytics

-
More information

  • Group reporting 2508 feature deck
  • Group reporting 2508 help portal
  • Recap of group reporting new features
  • Group reporting community
  • Group reporting customer influence platform

entry.title: What's New for Joule in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud-2508
entry.content:
Hi Community,

Here is a blog post of What's New features introduced in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud 2508 edition in the exciting world of SAP Joule.

New use cases now supported

Joule now enables you to view business data of many SAP objects like Process order , Solution order, Enterprise project , Inspection methods , Work Centers and many more...

Update Delivery Date for Purchase Orders

Joule enables you, as a purchaser, to update delivery dates for purchase orders.

For example, when suppliers or equivalent sources inform you of delays or changes, you can use Joule to update the delivery dates with the new information.

Checking sales order fulfillment status

Joule allows you to check whether a sales order's fulfillment is on track and identify the issues that block its fulfillment. For each sales order, Joule can tell whether such issues exist in the order processing phase. If yes, you can display issue details, view possible causes and handling suggestions for each issue, and navigate to related apps.

Expiring Prices Handling

Joule now enables you to manage expiring prices (stored as condition records for pricing in sales) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. With Joule, you can fetch prices that will expire soon, extend their valid-to dates, and adjust their condition amounts or ratios as you need.

Electronic Document Error Explanations

The Manage Electronic Documents app now enables natural language interaction with Joule, making it easier to understand electronic document exchange errors. You can ask Joule for error explanations and recommended resolution steps. By providing detailed insights, SAP Joule helps you understand the root cause of errors and offers guidance on corrective actions.

There are many more features which can be explored by clicking on the What's New Viewer link https://help.sap.com/docs/joule/capabilities-guide/what-s-new-for-joule-capabilities

Thanks!!!

Explore the SAP Business AI features with SAP Joule.

Regards

Shubham

Joule SAP Business AI SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

entry.title: Understanding CNNs (Convolutional Neural Networks) in under 5 minutes
entry.content:
AI isnâ€™t a dream of the future anymore; itâ€™s all around us. With countless acronyms and concepts to grasp, one you canâ€™t afford to ignore if you want to thrive at consulting is CNN, as itâ€™s reshaping how companies operate and create value in digital economies. 

In this quick guide, weâ€™ll break down what CNNs are, why they matter, and how you can start building the skills to bring this knowledge into your consulting career. 

ğŸ‘‰Read through to the end for a resource that will help you take the first step in developing these skills. 

 
So, What is a CNN?  

A CNN (Convolutional Neural Network) is a type of deep brain network that takes hints from how we see. Inspired by the way human brains interpret visual signals, it spots lines, edges, shapes, and patterns. Unlike the â€œold brainâ€ webs that "see" each bit alone, CNNs can keep track of where things are. This helps them deal with big sets of pics, clips, etc.  

Why Convolutional? Well, the CNNs maintain spatial relationships by using layers called â€œconvolutionsâ€ Read more here 

How does a CNN run? (In 3 steps) 

  • The â€œConvolutional Layerâ€ has three components: the input, which is an image, a kernel (also known as a filter) to detect features like lines, edges, or colors; and an output, which is a feature map summarizing the features found.   
  • The â€œPooling Layerâ€: This layer simplifies the size of the feature map, keeping only the most important information.   
  • The â€œFully Connectedâ€ Layer takes all that information and uses it to perform classification or regression tasks

What is the difference between CNN and DNN?  

  • A DNN, Deep Neural Network, is an â€œAI brain webâ€ with lots of links. It sees facts piece by piece, making it good for tasks like seeing pics, hearing speech, & dealing with words.  
  • CNN is a kind of specialized DNN, well-suited for handling image data. The key difference is the ability to apply filters to the input image to extract key features. The information extracted through these layers is then passed to â€œfully connected layers,â€ which analyze the features and can generate predictions.   

 

 The big gap is what they do best: DNNs are all-around and work with many kinds of tasks. CNNs are top at jobs that need seeing & knowing visual facts.   

What are CNNs mainly used for

Tasks with Pics  

CNNs work well at sorting, classifying, and detecting objects in images. They have transformed how companies manage visual information: from predictive maintainance tasks in manufacturing to smart supply chain management.  

Dealing with Docs  

CNNs are widely used to automate the extraction of information from documents such as invoices, receipts, and contracts. Instead of relying on manual work or rigid rule-based systems, CNNs can identify and capture key data pointssuch as dates, monetary values, and vendor names with higher accuracy and speed. This also reduces human error, streamlines workflows, and ensures more reliable data for follow-up processes. 

Seeing Things Early  

As said, CNNs are great for looking at things. And they are the perfect ally in enterprise contexts to â€œsee things earlyâ€. CNNs can help look at data coming from equipment and machinery, for instance, and detect patterns and anomalies that signal possible failures. This potentially cuts costs & keeps work smooth.  

CNNs in the SAP Ecosystem

The integration of Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) and other advanced AI technologies within SAP Business AI  is reshaping how businesses run and their competitiveness. 

This means clients will increasingly expect you to explain not only the technology, but also the business value it creates. By embedding artificial intelligence into foundational business systems, SAP enables enterprises to enhance operational efficiency, leverage data-driven insights, and drive sustained innovation. As the company continues to evolve its AI offerings, consultants who can connect these capabilities to business outcomes will be the ones helping organizations achieve long-term success in an increasingly competitive marketplace. 

ğŸ‘‰If you want to kickstart your career in consulting, explore the SAP Young Professionals Program,  an initiative designed to upskill young talent in SAPâ€™s latest solutions and prepare them as Associate Consultants, ready to deliver value across the SAP ecosystem.

entry.title: ABAP AI - Chapter 2
entry.content:
Summary

  • New ABAP AI capabilities keep coming
  • Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities remain free of charge
  • Availability of ABAP AI in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition in release 2025 is ahead of us
  • ABAP AI will be available in older releases of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition as well, details and updates expected at TechEd.

In February 2025, we started the first chapter of ABAP AI and announced that Joule speaks ABAP. Now, itâ€™s time to get ready for chapter 2!

In the past months, we have been delivering more Joule skills to speed up ABAP Cloud development, and we are now able to create RAP business objects â€“ from the database table up to the UI service powered by generative AI. We can create unit tests, explain code, complete code in the editor, implement validations and determinations, and much more (see also our public slide deck). All these skills are part of the 2508 release of SAP BTP ABAP Environment and SAP Cloud ERP (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition), and they will be included in the SAP Cloud ERP Private (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition) in the 2025 release. Please check out our updated tutorial on ABAP AI capabilities. In addition, we will continue to expand our AI scope and will deliver on the transformation aspect of our AI strategy. This starts with the 2025 delivery for SAP Cloud ERP Private, followed by AI capabilities in the custom code migration app in SAP BTP ABAP Environment 2602. Please visit our roadmap to keep track of our deliveries.

Letâ€™s continue with commercials and keep it short: The free promotions we introduced at the beginning of the year have been extended until further notice! We are convinced that, in the current situation, we donâ€™t want to put any commercial barriers on our offering and let all customers and partners benefit from AI-driven development. The corresponding material numbers for customers 8019124 and TDD partners 8019541 remain the same and can be ordered again. For those who started before the extension of the promotion, note that a re-ordering of the material is required. The procedure for the SAP BTP ABAP Environment and SAP Cloud ERP remains the same as well, and the initial blog post has been updated to reflect this, as well as SAP Note 3571857.
For SAP Cloud ERP Private, as of release 2025, the material numbers are also valid. However, the configuration will need to be done manually by you. Detailed information on this will follow.

But that is not enough. Will ABAP AI capabilities become available also for older releases of SAP Cloud ERP Private? Yes!
Imagine an ABAP AI service running side-by-side to your ABAP instance, providing full access to ABAP AI capabilities across hybrid landscapes. This includes SAP BTP ABAP Environment, SAP Cloud ERP, and SAP Cloud ERP Private. New AI innovations become available independently of release upgrades or support packages, allowing immediate leveraging.  Best of all, this ABAP AI service can also be connected to older releases of SAP Cloud ERP Private.

Sounds like a dream? Letâ€™s find out â€“ stay tuned for TechEd 2025 to receive all the news and updates!

entry.title: ğŸš€ SAP BTP Weekly: Practical AI, Enhanced Analytics, and a Vision for the Future
entry.content:
1. Joule Studio and No-Code AI Agents
Creating intelligent agents without coding is now possible in SAP Build. This opens the door for both business and IT teams to build copilots that answer questions and automate tasks quickly.

Beyond the no-code hype, the challenge is cultural: will users trust an internally developed agent? Imagine a procurement team building an agent to negotiate with suppliersâ€”it speeds up the process, but what if the agent misinterprets company policies? Human oversight remains essential.

ğŸ”— https://www.sap.com/spain/products/artificial-intelligence/joule-studio.html 

2. Joule for Consultants
A new program helps SAP consultants use Joule as a copilot during implementations. It includes guides, templates, and real-world use cases that can be applied directly to client projects.

The potential lies in reducing configuration time and accelerating deployments. But it also raises questions: to what extent will Joule replace manual tasks? For example, in a SuccessFactors project, it could generate initial configurations within minutesâ€”though expert validation will always be required.

ğŸ”— https://www.sap.com/spain/products/artificial-intelligence/ai-assistant/sap-consulting-capability.html 

3. Integration with Event Mesh and Kafka
SAP Advanced Event Mesh now connects with Apache Kafka, enabling hybrid and decentralized architectures. This allows for more resilient micro-integrations compared to traditional point-to-point models.

The practical challenge lies in governance. A retail company might use it to synchronize inventories across multiple channels in seconds, but managing topics and ensuring traceability can become complex. SAP provides connectors, but the learning curve is real.

ğŸ”— https://events.sap.com/eur-expertsession-aemkafka/en_us/home.html 

4. Real-World FinOps on BTP
Companies adopting FinOps on BTP are gaining visibility and achieving up to 20% reductions in cloud costs. Dashboards and alerts help CIOs and CFOs make faster decisions.

The challenge is organizational: finance and IT often â€œspeak different languages.â€ Imagine a telco optimizing Integration Suite consumptionâ€”without internal agreements, discussions about who pays what can escalate. The technology is ready, governance isnâ€™t always.

ğŸ”— https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/enhanced-finops-capabilities-for-sap-btp/ba-p/14113797 

5. SAP Build Process Automation
New preconfigured processes allow automation of HR, compliance, and finance tasks in days. A â€œshortcutâ€ for organizations seeking efficiency without large-scale projects.

The tricky part is resistance to change. An HR team may see value in automating vacation approvals, but users often fear losing control. SAP provides ready-to-use processes, but tailoring them to each organization still requires effort.

ğŸ”— https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/public-site-for-sap-build-pre-built-content/ba-p/13562272 

6. BDC and Databricks: Next-Generation Analytics
The integration between SAP BTP Data & Analytics (BDC) and Databricks enables unification of SAP and non-SAP data in lakehouse environments for AI and advanced analytics.

Picture a mining company combining SAP financial data with IoT sensor data in Databricks: the predictive potential is enormous. The challenge lies in governance: without a clear model, â€œdata democratizationâ€ can turn into chaos. SAP ensures traceability, but governance is each organizationâ€™s responsibility.

ğŸ”— https://news.sap.com/2025/02/sap-databricks-open-bold-new-era-data-ai/ 

7. SAP Now Argentina â€“ Business Highlights
The event showcased how local companies are applying SAP BTP and Joule to real business processes. Applied AI was the highlight, with use cases in retail, energy, and manufacturing.

Beyond the excitement, scalability remains a question. Can a successful pilot in one area be extended across the entire organization? Use cases inspire, but customers still need clarity on timelines and adoption costs.

ğŸ”— https://www.sap.com/products/data-cloud/databricks.html 

8. SAP Customer Success Day â€“ Our Experience
This week we had the privilege of meeting with over 20 customers in an exclusive workshop on enterprise integration, exploring the power of SAP BTP Advanced Event Mesh (AEM) and SAP Integration Suite.

Beyond the technology, what stood out was how different customers face similar challenges: shifting from point-to-point to event-driven models without losing control or simplicity. A bank raised the need to process thousands of transactions in real time; a retail company sought to orchestrate omnichannel inventory. Everyone agreed the key is not just the tool, but the ability to redesign processes.

ğŸ”— https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7369726725749903369/ 

At the end of the day, BTP is experienced differently depending on the role: for a CIO itâ€™s efficiency and control, for an architect itâ€™s integration, for a Basis administrator itâ€™s security, and for a consultant itâ€™s delivery speed. Yet ultimately, we all face the same question: how do we create real business value from technology without getting lost in complexity?

entry.title: Joule Setup for SAP Digital Manufacturing
entry.content:
We're excited to announce that Joule, SAPâ€™s AI-powered enterprise copilot, is officially integrated into SAP Digital Manufacturing. This marks the first-ever availability of Joule in the Digital Manufacturing domain, enabling manufacturers to tap into intelligent, conversational insights right within their production environments 

SAP Digital Manufacturing is a suite of cloud-based and on-premise solutions that enables manufacturers to digitize, monitor, control, and optimise their production operations in real time. It integrates manufacturing processes with enterprise business systems, bridging the gap between ERP (like SAP S/4HANA) and shop floor operations, supporting Industry 4.0 and smart factory initiatives. 

Core Capabilities Supported Scope 

  • Production Execution 
  • Enterprise and Shop Floor Integration 
  • Visual Work Instructions 
  • Quality Management 
  • Manufacturing Analytics & KPIs (via DMi) 
  • Production Orchestration & Monitoring 
  • Resource and Material Management 
  • Edge Integration / IoT Enablement 
  • Sustainability & Compliance 

 

Supported Languages:  

Please refer to the link for most up to date information on languages supported by Joule.  

 please note to validate the data centers supported by Joule here.  

**************************************************************************************************************************

This blog post is a series for Joule Activation: 

  • SAP Business AI â€“ Overview for all !!! (Includes information on Joule Supported Data Centers, Different scenarios during Joule setup, etc..) 
  • Joule - Unified Setup: Bridging Simplicity and Performance (Demo Video to understand the Unified Setup, Joule basics & architecture, how to set up Joule, etc...)  
  • Joule for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition - A Comprehensive Setup Guide 
  • Joule Setup â€“ End-to-End Setup Guide (for all Line of Business) Unified Approach 
  • Joule for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - Setup Guide 
  • SAP Digital Supply Chain 
  • Joule for SAP Integrated Business Planning (SAP IBP) â€“ Setup Guide 
  • Joule â€“ Getting Started with Document Grounding - setup guide 
  • Activate Joule with SAP Build Work Zone and SAP Mobile Start 
  • Analytics Insights in Joule â€“ Setup Guide 
  • Joule in SAP Signavio Process Transformation Suite â€“ Setup Guide 
  • Joule Setup for SAP Integrated Product Development 

Joule for SAP Digital Manufacturing  (You are Here) 

Blogs - Work in Progress (WIP): 

  • SAP SuccessFactors Joule Activation (Refer to SAP Discovery Centre) 
  • SAP Digital Supply Chain (WIP) 
  • SAP Asset Performance Management 
  • SAP Product Lifecycle Management 
  • SAP Concur 
  • SAP Ariba 
  • and more to be added towards General Availability 

This blog will uncover the steps to activate Joule in two different ways: Section (1): create a Joule SAP Digital Manufacturing as a standalone product (Fresh activation), Section (2): Activating and adding Joule SAP Digital Manufacturing with an existing subaccount along with your other activated / current LoBs landscape  

**************************************************************************************************************************

Scenario 

You want to integrate the generative AI copilot Joule with your SAP Digital Manufacturing application and require information about what to consider when you want to use Joule. 

Use Cases 

The following feature is available for Joule in SAP Digital Manufacturing: 

Conversational search of application help: Ask Joule questions about the SAP Digital Manufacturing apps and processes, and Joule gives you an answer based on the SAP Digital Manufacturing documentation from the SAP Help Portal.  

Pre-requisites 

  • Ensure that you meet all requirements for Joule onboarding. For more information, refer to Prerequisites in the Joule Onboarding Guide. 
  • You have an entitlement for Joule in the same global account on SAP BTP as your entitlement for SAP Digital Manufacturing. 
  • You have subscribed to SAP Digital Manufacturing. 

 

Integration Process: 

If you are activating Joule for the very first time for your SAP Digital Manufacturing system, then we refer to it as a standalone/single setup, as mentioned in â€œSection 1â€.   

In this standalone setup process, you may decide to use the same SAP BTP Subaccount to activate Joule, or you may plan to use a new subaccount or if you would like to add SAP Digital Manufacturing to an existing subaccount and activate Joule that can be used which is a unified setup as described below in â€œSection 2â€. 

What does Unified Setup mean? 

The unified setup of Joule with multiple SAP products allows business users to ask any question irrespective of the Joule client they are in. This approach helps avoid toggling between multiple applications, improves user efficiency, and delivers a more consistent, connected experience across all LoBs. 

Check your setup plan: 

By now, we hope you've selected one of the setup plans. Before we begin activating Joule for SAP Digital Manufacturing, letâ€™s take a moment to understand how Joule works. 

image below explains how Joule works with your landscape integration 

Note: In the current release of Joule for DM, we do not use the SAP Build Work Zone and Cloud Foundry services. This is planned for the next releases.â€¯â€¯â€¯ 

Now, since you have a clear understanding about Digital Manufacturing and how Joule works now it is time for us to start the integration process:  

Let us have a look at the steps involved for the integration: 

**************************************************************************************************************************

Integrating Joule  

  • Step 1: Setup Plan:  
    • Section 1: New Digital Manufacturing setup with no prior Joule setup. 
    • Section 2: You have an existing Joule subaccount, and you want to enable Joule for Digital Manufacturing 

*************************************************************************************************************************

Step 1: Setup Plan 

Section 1: New Digital Manufacturing setup with no prior Joule setup. 

If you already have some experience with SAP BTP (Business Technology Platform) we request you to follow the steps in this blog - Joule Setup â€“ End-to-End Setup Guide (for all Line of Business) Unified Approach. In this blog, please check Section 2 (Check your SAP BTP Account for Joule Entitlements. 

If this is your first time using the SAP DM (Digital Manufacturing) platform and you're unsure how to proceed with the activation, donâ€™t worry - weâ€™ve got you covered. Just follow the steps below to activate Joule for SAP DM easily.â€¯ 

Fresh Digital Manufacturing setup â€“ no existing Joule configuration 

  1. Create the Subaccount and choose the relevant Data Centre 
  2. Set up Trust Configuration with SAP Cloud Identity Service 
  3. Add Entitlements 
  4. Run the Booster and Integrations with the Product SAP Digital Manufacturing 
    • Note: Choose the SAP Digital Manufacturing Test as product to enable Joule in your SAP Digital Manufacturing quality tenant. 
  5. Add the role â€œJoule_Userâ€ from the dmc application to a role collection 
    • Note: Assign those business users to the role collection that needs to interact with Joule. 
  6. Configure trusted domains in identity authentication for the SAP Digital Manufacturing domain 
    • Note: For more information, refer to Configure Trust to the Identity Authentication Tenant. 
  7. Configure a trusted domain in SAP BTP Cockpit for the same SAP Digital Manufacturing system
    • Note: For more information, refer to Configure Trusted Domain in SAP BTP. 
  8. Add the DM_USER User Role Collection to Launch the Joule
  9. See Joule in Action 

Step (1): Create the Subaccount and choose the relevant Data Centre 

Check this blog and follow step No â€“ 5 

Check this blog and follow step No â€“ 4 

Step (2): Set up Trust Configuration with SAP Cloud Identity Service 

Check this blog and follow step No â€“ 7 

 

 

 

Step (3): Add Entitlements 

Check this blog and follow step No â€“ 8  

 

 

Step (4): Run the Booster and Integrations with the Product SAP Digital Manufacturing 

The complete setup process is documented in this blog. Step No. 10 explains the process. For simplification, we have the simplified steps and images below.â€¯ 

  • Click on Global Account -> Select Booster -> Search for Joule -> Run the Boosterâ€¯
