The system will validate the entitlements required. Once itâ€™s green, you can click on Nextâ€¯ 

Select the SAP BTP Subaccount and click on Nextâ€¯ 

Select Integrations, you will be able to see the options for SAP IPD, select it, and click on Nextâ€¯ 

 

 

Once you select the DM System, you can click on Next, review the selections, and click on Finish. The booster will take 5-9 minutes to activate Joule and set up the integrations with your DM system.â€¯ 

Joule will now return the success message after the integrations are completed. You can validate this setup by navigating to Systems and Formation, searching for the Joule formation that will be created for your setup, as shown below.â€¯â€¯ 

Step (5): Add the role â€œJoule_Userâ€ from the dmc application to a role collection 

  • After the booster run has completed and formation checks, add the role â€œJoule_Userâ€ from the dmc application to a role collection.  
  • Assign those business users to the role collection that needs to interact with Joule. 

Click on Subaccount -> Role Collections -> Create -> Joule_User -> Edit -> Role Name 

 

Step (6): Configure trusted domains in identity authentication for the SAP Digital Manufacturing domain 

  • For more information, refer to Configure Trust to the Identity Authentication Tenant. 

Open Cloud Identity Services -> click on Applications & Resources -> External Services -> Trusted Domains -> Add 

 

Step (7): Configure a trusted domain in SAP BTP Cockpit for the same SAP Digital Manufacturing system 

  • For more information, refer to Configure Trusted Domain in SAP BTP. 

Open Sub Account -> Security -> Settings -> Trusted Domains -> Add  

Step (8): Assign the role in Subaccount to launch the Joule 

Open Sub Account -> Security -> Role Collection > Create -> Add (DM_ROLE) 

 

 Step (9)  See Joule in Action

Congratulations on successfully setting up the SAP DM Standalone system!â€¯ 

â€¯ 
Now, letâ€™s walk through how to add SAP DM to your existing subaccount alongside your other active Lines of Business (LoBs).â€¯ 

Step 1: Setup Plan 

Section 2: You have an existing Joule subaccount, and you want to enable Joule for DM. In this option, we will show you how to activate DM in the context of an existing Joule formation. Within your SAP BTP Global Account, navigate to System Landscapes, click on Formationsâ€¯ 

Search for the Joule formation you have already set up. In my case, â€œI am using one of the existing formations, which has multiple SAP products connected to one Joule instance, as shown belowâ€. You can click on Include Systems. â€¯ 

 

In the new window, filter for SAP Digital Manufacturing and click on Next step.â€¯â€¯ 

 

Select the option â€œEnable Capability Deploymentâ€ and â€œEnable the Joule Icon in Integrated Systemâ€ and click on Review 

 

Validate the selections and click on Include.â€¯â€¯ 

The process may take 5 to 8 minutes to complete, and you should be able to see the synchronizing option, as shown image below. 

 

Once the status turns green and Ready, we are good to use Joule with Digital Manufacturing capabilities.  

Congratulations on successfully setting up SAP Digital Manufacturing with the Unified Approach! 

In a similar approach, you may use Joule with a unified experience in other SAP products that you have integrated in the same subaccount. 

If you have any questions about the setup, you can reach us at SAP_AI_RIG@sap.com  

Thank you for staying connected with our blog and successfully activating Joule for SAP Digital Manufacturing ! 

 
We hope youâ€™ve had an exciting experience exploring the power of Joule, your intelligent business companion. From insightful decisions to streamlined processes, we trust youâ€™re already seeing the incredible value Joule brings to your day-to-day work. 

Hereâ€™s smarter, faster, and more impactful outcomes powered by Joule! ğŸš€

entry.title: Free Joule Base! What does it mean for SAP's resellers?
entry.content:
Over the last months SAP has made several announcements related to making Joule free for customers.  In this article I will review the current status and share my thoughts this topic and the opportunities for SAP channel partners.

My take on SAP making Joule Base free:   There are real costs involved.  When users query Joule SAP leverages LLMs to deal with the quiry and this has costs for SAP.  SAP does not pass this on to users.   But obviously, businesses donâ€™t give away anything for free without a reason.  In my opinion, SAP has showed commitment to its statement that Joule will be the new UI of SAP solutions.  This is a strategic move for the future.    The core value and â€œcrown jewelâ€ of SAP is its automation of business processes.  Making it easy and simple for customers to consume these core capabilities will make SAPâ€™s core solutions more consumed and successful.  And that is where the important revenue streams for SAP are.

Joule is becoming more and more a platform.  Sometimes Joule is even called the AI OS of SAP.  Further, Joule and Joule agents also have the potential to leverage AI to integration all the SAP solutions as needed, on the fly.  Some people say SAP solutions could be better integrated,  perhaps Joule and Joule Agents will be a big step forward in this area?

Joule is becoming so central for SAP offerings and solutions that it makes sense to democratize it. 

What exactly do customers get for free?

Customers get â€œJoule Baseâ€ for free.  In my opinion, this is pretty much the â€œclassicâ€ Joule we heard about when SAP launched Joule last year.   Till now, Joule was available for some LOB solutions, but with limitation on how many free â€œJule requestsâ€ a user was granted. And initially, transactional pattern was not included in the free Joule Base launched at Sapphire this year. However, transactional pattern is now included and there is no limit to the free requests / usage by the user.

With Joule Base users can leverage three types of activities (called Joule patterns): 

  • Navigational: ask a question in your own words related to what you want to do in the system and Joule will analyze your question together with LLMs and propose the best SAP app / screen for you to leverage.   Is these capabilities valuable for a user?  If a user always does the same activities and is an expert in the system, this might have limited value.  But if a user complain that SAP is difficult to work with this can absolutely help.  Also, for new users and existing users needing to do something new in the system the capabilities (together with informational pattern) can be very useful.  Finally, an interesting perspective from a channel partner always positioning Joule to customers and prospects: with the new generation of people joining the workforce, tools like Joule will become more and more important.  The new generation of workers expect to be able to get help from the systems they are supposed to use and master, instead of learning everything upfront.
  • Informational:  user can ask a question about how the SAP system works and Joule will leverage SAP help portal and the LLMs to provide an answer: the relevant sections from the help portal will be collected, passed on to the LLM with the appropriate prompt, and the LLM will make a summary for the specific question of the user.   For example, â€œwhat is the difference between a service order and a service contractâ€.   Other examples can be questions about how certain accounting principles works in SAP.   Further, a very interesting opportunity for customers is to extend this capability with information about their own work instructions, policies etc as part of document grounding.  In my opinion, the costing of SAP document grounding is very appealing for smaller customers.
  • Transactional:  While â€œnavigationalâ€ and â€œinformationalâ€ patterns are high level & general information about the SAP solution, transactional action is more about the customer specific business data in the system. Joule can retrieve data about specific business data information.  Example: â€œShow prices for sales organization 1710 that are due to expire before December 31, 2025â€.   Joule can even change data in the system.  Instead of going to a specific app to do an action, a user can write in their own works instruction for joule to change the data.  For example: â€œExtend the valid-to dates by one weekâ€ (Joule will know you refer to the previous question about sales prices).   In my opinion, these capabilities can be valuable but are pretty â€œlightâ€ in terms of AI.  SAP Business AI can also do much more sophisticated & generative transactional actions in the system, but those activities have much higher run costs and is part of Premium AI offerings for which customers must pay extra.

 

Check out more on the AI commercialization on PE Portal

Joule runs on SAP BTP.  To run Joule Base, a customer thus needs to have an SAP BTP account. If a customer does not have an BTP account, they will get the needed entitlements for free.  

What are my opportunities as reseller when Joule base is free? 

If Joule Base is free, there is nothing to resell, right?  So, what is in it for resellers?   The topic is much more strategic than this.  SAPâ€™s resellers donâ€™t only â€œsell stuffâ€, they also take care of customers to ensure they get the most out of their SAP system, that customers are happy about their SAP system, order more services from the partner and keep renewing their SAP subscriptions (for which partner also get paid).  AI is probably the biggest technology trend at the moment, and I think it is great that channel partners can tell their customers that SAP has invested a lot in R&D to ensure their systems and investment stay up to date with technology.  My recommendation to resellers is to position Joule Base part of what they get for their subscription payments and something which helps protect their investment in their SAP system.  

As partner, you can obviously do services around advising and implementing Joule Base for the customer.   And there are a lot of opportunities to do additional AI work for customers on top of Joule Base, including reselling Joule Premium packages and developing customer specific AI capabilities.

What does customers NOT get with Joule Base?

There are basically three categories of capabilities customers donâ€™t get and must pay extra for if they want to use them:

  • Joule Premium PUPM packages..  There are many deep/niche AI embedded capabilities which is only available in via Joule Premium packages.  Examples are  Financial business insight for ERP Cloud, Performance Goal creation in SuccessFactors and E-mail draft recommender for Service Cloud V2.   These capabilities go much deeper than Joule transactional capabilities and consume significant more LLM capacity.  Thus, these are charged separately.  These functionalities are triggers by users and thus included in the new Per User Per Month (PUPM) packages. 
  • Transactional Capabilities.  Finally, there are some AI powered capabilities not triggered by users, but by â€œthe systemâ€.  These capabilities are therefore priced based on a transactional metering.  Example of this is "Document Grounding": the upfront indexing of customer specific documents so that they can be leveraged by users (free) via joule base informational pattern later.
  • Analytical Pattern: There is a fourth Joule pattern only available in Joule Premium packages, and that is â€œAnalytical Patternâ€; the capability for Joule to respond to user prompts about analytical analysis of their SAP data.  Note: customers also need to run SAP Analytic Cloud (SAC) for this to work.  In general, this pattern has been developed by the central Joule team, but most of the LOB product teams still need to make the connection between Joule, LOB solution and SAC. So this pattern is not available yet for most LOB solutions.

What does a customer need to do to get Joule base for free?

While it is free, Joule Base is not automatically available for all customers.  The reason is there are specific AI terms and conditions which SAP wants customers to sign before they get access to Joule.  â€œOldâ€ customers donâ€™t have these T&C in their contract.  The easiest way for customers to get Joule Base is to â€œpurchase â€Joule Base on the SAP store (at a cost of 0,00).   This will trigger the signing of the T&Cs and assignment of the entitlements in the customerâ€™s system.

Can I as partner also get Joule Base for free for my TDD environment?

Yes.   For ERP Cloud, SuccessFactors, IBP and Digital Manufacturing, get it here for free for your LOB TDD system.  There is no TDD for ERP Cloud Private so there is also no Joule on TDD either.  However, this is planned to change in Q4 2025.  For CX, Joule is not in GA yet but expected to come later this year, also for TDD.

If you are interested in more details, check out these documents: 

ERP Cloud

ERP Cloud Private

SuccessFactors

Customer Experience

entry.title: AI-driven, Joule-enabled Warehouse Resource & Operations Management for SAP EWM on S/4 HANA 2023
entry.content:
It is a topic in every warehouse: Supervisors and Warehouse Operations Managers would like to see their planned workload for the day and see in real-time whether shipping times will be met. If shipping times are in jeopardy, the warehouse system is then expected to evaluate if an optimized resource allocation could pro-actively solve any potential delays. When a more optimal usage of the available resources is found, resources should automatically be directed to the critical areas. Being able to take action proactively is of the essence, because we do not want to only take action when we are already in delay.

The following is an example of an AI-driven, Joule enabled Application that can accomplish the above outlined requirements and activities supported by AI. The Application leverages the embedded AI in the EWM Private Cloud Edition S/4 HANA 2023 FPS03 release and the Joule Studio available in SAP Build.

 

 

The Architecture of the Application looks as follows:

 

AI-based Warehouse Workload Visibility

In the current version of the Application, the expected workloads of picking and packing operations are calculated leveraging the embedded AI capabilities in SAP EWM, which are then displayed in the UI5 Application (see in the example below):

It is also clearly visible in which Activity Area the workload is currently exceeding the planned Resource capacity.

The Application then further allows a manual simulation of adding or removing Resources to evaluate the impact in a given activity area. 

The fully "automatic rebalancing" function evaluates whether it is possible to optimize the resource allocation to the different areas, considering the allowed resource types in an Activity Area.

If an optimized resource allocation is possible, the warehouse operations manager, can accept these changes and the resources will be reassigned in the EWM system so that they will receive workload to execute from the new area.

Joule-enabled with custom EWM Joule Skills

Further more the current version of the Application provides Joule support for Warehouse Operations Management with the following Joule Skills:

- Joule Skill 1: Current Workload Analysis: Provide a comprehensive analysis of the current workload associated with picking and packing operations, considering the current resource allocation across different warehouse areas, as well as dependent scheduling of packing activities.
- Joule Skill 2: Provide Optimized Resource Allocation: Simulate an optimal workforce allocation strategy to mitigate bottlenecks and criticalities within the warehouse operations, to avoid shipping delays.
- Joule Skill 3: Accept Optimized Resource Allocation: Accept the optimization results and reassign the resources in EWM to the new areas.   

Coming soon an AI Agent will be introduce that autonomously orchestrates workforce allocation (monitored by the supervisor).

For more Information on this Application & AI functionality please contact SAP Services (EWMServices@sap.com).

entry.title: Joule for Developers with SAP BTP ABAP Environment-Setup Guide
entry.content:
Introduction:

On average, an SAP ABAP developer spends approximately 2 hours understanding the functional specification before beginning the coding process. Depending on the requirement, complexity, and the developerâ€™s experience, he may take a day or two or more.

Over the years, every SAP customer has invested significant effort in custom developments, extensions, testing, and optimizing the code. Imagine if the developer is on vacation or has transitioned to a different project; in such cases, new code changes or updates become a considerable challenge for a new developer to manage.

From my years of SAP ABAP development experience, I have worked on several internal and customer requirements with few to many challenges understanding the code. With the introduction of AI in the current trend, SAP has been one of the front-runners in introducing AI capabilities. Let me take this opportunity to introduce you to SAP Joule for Developers (in short J4D).

â€œJouleâ€ is the SAP copilot that ABAP developers need for their development tasks. It is uniquely trained on SAP data and processes. Joule's ABAP developer capabilities combine all the features to support full-stack development with ABAP Cloud. For instance, Joule provides real-time explanations of development objects, streamlining learning and finding answers to questions. Joule is fully integrated in the ABAP Development Tools for Eclipse and provides accurate information about currently opened development objects or marked lines of code. Joule is also able to predict and generate subsequent lines of code based on comments, or the code you're typing. The Joule code prediction takes the ABAP language version of your selected development object into account and suggests ABAP code that fits the respective language version context. Joule can generate ABAP cloud development scenarios, including all required development objects.

Why Joule for ABAP Developers:

The AI capabilities for ABAP are designed to enhance developer productivity by delivering new generative AI-powered assistance for frequent developer tasks. The ABAP AI capabilities utilize a purpose-built large language model (LLM) trained on 250 million lines of ABAP code to deliver the most precise, contextual results for ABAP workloads.

Benefits?

Joule can understand SAP development framework intricacies, anticipate developersâ€™ needs, offer intelligent suggestions, and automate repetitive, mundane tasks like documentation and sample data generation. It can enable developers across pro-code and automation projects to be more productive, creative, and proficient in accelerating apps or extensions for business applications.

  • Predictive code completion based on context, comments, and project heuristics
  • Code explanations of core data services (CDS) view entities, classes, interfaces, and functional modules
  • AI-powered assistance for documentation, best practices, and new concepts
  • Boost developer productivity

Here is a glimpse of all the Joule for Developers(J4D) capabilities that it offers:

 

What license is required?

J4D is a part of SAP AI Unit (8019164), - the new Per User Per Month (PUPM) license model released by SAP for all requirements. However, we also have a limited offer with Joule for Developers (8019124) limited promotion, which is valid only until Q2 '2026. For more details on the limited option, please refer to the Blogpost and take a look at the SAP Note: 3571857.

Joule for developers ABAP AI capabilities is technically available in SAP BTP ABAP Environment and SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Public Edition after the upgrade to release 2502.

After purchasing the license:

  • SAP BTP ABAP Environment 
    All development tenants (where this license (8019164) is assigned/activated) in the corresponding SAP BTP Global Account are automatically enabled for the usage of Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities will show up only in one BTP Account where SKU is assigned.

Setup / Architecture diagram?

 

All requests to large language models are routed from ABAP to the AI foundation on SAP BTP. The use cases in the Accelerate category are managed by SAP. Once the subscription explained above is in place, the configuration part in your system is done automatically by SAP. Finally, update your ABAP Development Tools for Eclipse to the latest version using the link ADT version update to get the Joule integration in the IDE. Developers who shall be allowed to use Joule need the respective authorizations as explained in the documentation.

Use Cases: This documentation explains the ABAP development tools for Eclipse and refers to the range of functions that have been shipped as part of the standard delivery for the following products:

  • SAP BTP ABAP environment - If the user has ABAP SKU :8011136(Free), 8006181/8006182(Standard).  Use current blog steps to setup Joule for developers.                                                                                                                                                                                                           ABAP Service Plans-Service Plans and Metering for SAP BTP ABAP environment | SAP Help Portal, Know more-SAP Discovery Center Service - ABAP environment
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition as of 2502- If the user doesn't have ABAP SKU as mentioned above, please use S/4 HANA PCE to setup Joule for Developers                                                                                                                                                                                                                   Setup Guide-Joule for Developer with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition-Setup Guide - SAP Community

Help doc: ABAP Development Tools 2502 GA Doc

Pre-requisite:

  • SAP BTP (Administrator role within subaccount)
    •  Joule Entitlements - please refer to license topic
      • ABAP environment-Standard
      • Cloud foundry
    • SAP Cloud Identity Services

Discovery center use cases (ABAP): SAP Discovery Center Business AI Features

Roles and Authorizations

To be able to use Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities, your system administrator must assign you to a business role that contains the business catalogue SAP_A4C_BC_DEV_AIQ_PC.

Joule setup via SAP BTP (ABAP Environment).

Create a subaccount in your Global Account in SAP BTP.

 

 Enter a preferred Subaccount name, Select the region as per the Joule supported Data Centre and click on Create.

Help Doc (Data centers):

Entitlements

Under Entitlements: In this section, we add different service plans.

Add service plans: ABAP environment

Add multiple quantities of 1 ABAP_COMPUTE_UNIT, 2 HANA_COMPUTE_UNITS, 1 standard.

 

We are going to use Cloud Foundry for our Joule developer capability setup. To do so, navigate to your Overview page within your subaccount and click on Enable Cloud Foundry, as shown below:

 

Create a space where instances can be created and deployed with the required roles.

 

Know more about roles: About Roles in the Cloud Foundry Environment | SAP Help Portal

 

Security: Before Joule can assist your developers, trust and identity must be configured correctly. Hereâ€™s how to ensure your system knows whoâ€™s who and what theyâ€™re allowed to do.

Under the security, Maintain Trust Configuration:

Choose the SAP Cloud Identity tenant for users when logging on to applications in this subaccount.

In this screen, please validate if the Cloud Identity Service URL is using the domain model, â€œ*.accounts.cloud.sapâ€ or do you see â€œ*.accounts.ondemand.comâ€, select the appropriate domain.

 

Choose domain:

 

Configure Parameters

Enter the mandatory details: Name, Origin key, Text for user logon.

 

 Help Docs: Configure Trusted Domains in Identity Authentication | SAP Help Portal,

                         Configure Trusted Domain in SAP BTP | SAP Help Portal

 

Instance creation:

Under the space, create an instance of ABAP Environment:

 

 Create a new instance: Enter your instance name

 

Then, provide the email address (Mandatory) and system description in the parameter section.

Given Joule for developers is only supported in development; without this step, the setup won't work.

 

Note: At this point, this will only work if the same user whose email ID was provided under the admin email tries this. This is because additional users in the system haven't been created.

The instance is created.

 Click on the instance, it will redirect to a URL:

Note: At this point, this will only work if the same user whose email ID was provided under the admin email tries this. This is because additional users in the system haven't been created

Copy the URL: https://********* abap-web.eu10.hana.ondemand.com/ - Here the region is EU, for your setup, the region can be different.

 

 Access Management:

Select Identity and access management from the dropdown:

Here, the User can add/delete the business roles.

 

 Add developer Role (SAP_BR_DEVELOPER) to the user: To access the ABAP developer functionalities.

Once, All the above steps have been incorporated, Goto ABAP Development Tool (latest version)

 

Create a new ABAP Cloud project:

 

Paste the URL Copied:

 Log on to the ABAP service instance:

 

 

Select the Default identity provider/ custom IDP created.

Help doc: How to setup a Customer IDP

After you log in: Success message will appear.

Your project is created.

 

Joule for developerâ€™s capabilities.

AI-Based Feature

Description

More Information

Joule chat

The Joule chat supports you during the development process. Converse with the Joule chat in natural language, for instance, ask questions or obtain detailed explanations for code snippets or development objects.

For more information, see Chat.

Predictive Code Completion

The predictive code completion enables you to use AI-supported code completion in the ABAP source code editor.

For more information, see Predictive Code Completion.

Explain

The Explain feature enables you to get detailed explanations of selected development objects or lines of source code.

For more information, see Explain.

ABAP Unit

The AI-based ABAP Unit features are specifically designed to assist you in creating and improving your tests more effectively.

For more information, see ABAP Unit.

CDS Test Generation

The CDS test generation supports you in creating ABAP test classes for CDS entities.

For more information, see 

Generators

The Generators helps to boost your efficiency in generating unit test class for ABAP CDS entity.

For more information,

see Use CDS Test Class Generator | SAP Help Portal

Please look through the joule guide for more information: Joule Setup

Predictive Code Completion:

In the test class, create a new method like test_validate_customer_success (Positive scenario), try to create method test_validate_customer_failure (Negative scenario).

 

Press Enter: Application calculates predictive code.

Accept/discard.

 

 

 

 

In the search toolbar, search for joule:

 

 

 

 

 

In the joule pop up window:

Perform different operations:

 

Pretty printer the test class:

Joule lets the code modularize using pretty printer (Uppercase, Lowercase, spacing).

 

 

 Adding test cases

 

Joule helps to give some relevant test cases according to the code functionality.

 

 

FAQâ€™s: ABAP AI Strategy Frequently Asked Questions

Related Content:

Technical Announcement Blog: Joule speaks ABAP! - SAP Community

New landing page for SAP Joule for Developers: https://www.sap.com/products/artificial-intelligence/joule-for-developers.html

Thank you and regards,

Yash

entry.title: Joule for Developers with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition-Setup Guide
entry.content:
Introduction:

Typically, an SAP ABAP developer spends around two hours analyzing the functional specifications before diving into the actual coding. However, this time can vary significantly depending on the complexity of the requirement and the developerâ€™s level of experienceâ€”ranging from a single day to several.

Over time, SAP customers have heavily invested in custom development, system enhancements, rigorous testing, and code optimization. This leads to a common challenge: when a developer goes on leave or transitions to another project, understanding and maintaining their code can become a daunting task for someone new.

Drawing from my own experience in SAP ABAP development, Iâ€™ve frequently encountered difficulties in interpreting legacy codeâ€”whether developed internally or for customers. In today's AI-driven landscape, SAP has taken bold steps to integrate artificial intelligence into its development ecosystem. One such innovation is SAP Joule for Developers (J4D).

Joule is more than just a digital assistantâ€”itâ€™s an AI copilot specifically designed to support ABAP developers. What sets Joule apart is that it's trained on SAP-specific data and processes, making it deeply contextual. It assists throughout the full-stack ABAP Cloud development lifecycle, offering features like real-time explanations of development objects, intuitive code insights, and instant answers to development-related queries.

Integrated directly into the ABAP Development Tools for Eclipse, Joule offers context-aware support for open development objects and selected lines of code. It also predicts and generates ABAP code in real-time based on your comments or what youâ€™re typing. Importantly, it respects the language version of your development environment, ensuring that the suggestions align with the appropriate ABAP standards.

With Joule, developers can also generate complete ABAP Cloud development scenarios, including all necessary objectsâ€”significantly accelerating development and reducing the onboarding curve for new developers.

Why Joule for ABAP Developers:

The AI capabilities for ABAP are designed to enhance developer productivity by delivering new generative AI-powered assistance for frequent developer tasks. The ABAP AI capabilities utilize a purpose-built large language model (LLM) trained on 250 million lines of ABAP code to deliver the most precise, contextual results for ABAP workloads.

Benefits?

Joule can understand SAP development framework intricacies, anticipate developersâ€™ needs, offer intelligent suggestions, and automate repetitive, mundane tasks like documentation and sample data generation. It can enable developers across pro-code and automation projects to be more productive, creative, and proficient in accelerating apps or extensions for business applications.

  • Predictive code completion based on context, comments, and project heuristics
  • Code explanations of core data services (CDS) view entities, classes, interfaces, and functional modules
  • AI-powered assistance for documentation, best practices, and new concepts
  • Boost developer productivity

 

  What license is required?

. However, we also have a limited offer with Joule for Developers (8019124) limited promotion, which is valid only until Q2 '2026. For more details on the limited option, please refer to the Blogpost and take a look at the SAP Note: 3571857.

After purchasing the license:

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition -ABAP Environment 
    License (8019164) is assigned/activated, please be aware that it may take up to 24h after the process finished until all Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities are fully usable

Setup / Architecture diagram?

 

  • Joule is a software component, offered as Software-as-a-Service (managed, updated by SAP)â€‹
  • Joule runs technically on the SAP Business Technology Platformâ€‹
  • A central, single â€œproductiveâ€ tenant of Joule is recommendedâ€‹
  • It can be instantiated multiple times, while a subaccount translates to a tenant. E.g. in case customers want to have a sandbox installation, or a separated dedicated Jouleâ€‹
  • Respective tenants of SAP solutions (SAP SFSF, SAP S/4HANA Cloud) will then be â€œintegratedâ€ with a Joule tenant, manual process (â€œopt-inâ€)â€‹
  • The Joule UI (Joule Web Client) appears then embedded within a frame within the connected SAP solutionâ€‹
  • E.g. in case Joule is already set-up for SFSF the S4HANA system can simply be added to it!â€‹
  • A central Joule tenant requires a â€œunified Identity and Access Managementâ€ (same IAS tenant for all connected SAP solutions)â€‹
  • Current limitation: only 1 S/4HANA (Public/Private) tenant can be connected to a Joule tenant

 Finally, update your ABAP Development Tools for Eclipse to the latest version using the link ADT version update to get the Joule integration in the IDE. Developers who shall be allowed to use Joule need the respective authorizations as explained in the documentation.

Use Cases: This documentation explains the ABAP development tools for Eclipse and refers to the range of functions that have been shipped as part of the standard delivery for the following products:

  • SAP BTP ABAP environment - If the user has ABAP SKU :8011136(Free), 8006181/8006182(Standard).  Refer to Following blog steps to setup Joule for developers: Joule for Developers with SAP BTP ABAP Environment-Setup Guide - SAP Community            ABAP Service Plans-Service Plans and Metering for SAP BTP ABAP environment | SAP Help Portal, Know more-SAP Discovery Center Service - ABAP environment
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition as of 2502- If the user doesn't have ABAP SKU as mentioned above, please refer to current S/4 HANA PCE Blog to setup Joule for Developers                     

Help doc: ABAP Development Tools 2502 GA Doc

 Pre-requisite:

Please follow the following process to enable Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities in the development instance(s):

  • Logon to SAP for Me.
  • Under Dashboards, please choose Services & Support.
  • On the tab Service Requests, choose the New Service Request button.
  • The system displays the New Service Request dialog. Choose the radio button Partner & Other Cloud Services.
  • On the service request home page, choose the Create Service Request button.
  • Search for "Toggle Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities" and then open the service request.
  • Use the service request to toggle the Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities and find the actual toggle status therein.

      Please be aware that it may take up to 24h after the process finished until all Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities are fully usable

        Discovery Center use cases (ABAP): SAP Discovery Center Business AI Features

Roles and Authorizations

To be able to use Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities, your system administrator must assign you to a business role that contains the business catalogue SAP_A4C_BC_DEV_AIQ_PC.

More Information

Joule chat

The Joule chat supports you during the development process. Converse with the Joule chat in natural language, for instance, ask questions or obtain detailed explanations for code snippets or development objects.

For more information, see Chat.

Predictive Code Completion

The predictive code completion enables you to use AI-supported code completion in the ABAP source code editor.

For more information, see Predictive Code Completion.

Explain

The Explain feature enables you to get detailed explanations of selected development objects or lines of source code.

For more information, see Explain.

ABAP Unit

The AI-based ABAP Unit features are specifically designed to assist you in creating and improving your tests more effectively.

For more information, see ABAP Unit.

CDS Test Generation

The CDS test generation supports you in creating ABAP test classes for CDS entities.

For more information, see CDS Test Generation.

Generators

The Generators helps to boost your efficiency in generating unit test class for ABAP CDS entity.
